header_summary: A proposal to price space in the UTXO set is discussed, addressing concerns about UTXO management and privacy. The growth potential and storage limitations of the blockchain are explored, along with efforts to optimize storage. The issue of unconfirmed transactions, spam prevention, and the use of pre-segwit nodes are also examined.

recent_posts.title: Concern about "Inscriptions". (Keagan McClelland)
recent_posts.summary:
- The proposal to price space in the UTXO set raises concerns about UTXO management and privacy.
- Lack of pricing makes it challenging to distinguish legitimate transactions from spam.
- Pricing UTXOs based on resource costs could reduce unnecessary usage, but may offend Bitcoin users.

recent_posts.title: Concern about "Inscriptions"
recent_posts.summary:
- The blockchain's growth potential is high, but storage capacity is sufficient with cost-effective hardware.
- Unconfirmed transactions can be assessed for spam by pricing space in the UTXO set.
- Preventing spam transactions ("inscriptions") poses challenges, highlighting the need for economic solutions.

recent_posts.title: Concern about "Inscriptions". (ashneverdawn)
recent_posts.summary:
- The debate revolves around pricing the space in the UTXO set to identify spam transactions.
- Some argue for pricing UTXOs, while others believe in letting the market determine transaction priority.
- Efforts are being made to address the spam issue, but more discussion and community input are needed.

recent_posts.title: Jamming Mitigation Dry Run
recent_posts.summary:
- The research plan aims to validate local reputation algorithms using real-world data.
- It also aims to collect liquidity and slot utilization data and provide a common data export format.
- Multiple teams are involved in collecting data, propagating experimental endorsement, and implementing local reputation algorithms.

recent_posts.title: LN Summit 2023 Notes
recent_posts.summary:
- AJ suggests scaling up the Lightning Network by making the cost for attackers sufficient to ensure excess capacity for regular users.
- AJ proposes implementing fees for message spam and liquidity DoS prevention to turn attackers into a profit center.
- AJ suggests using precision in fees, addressing challenges like liquidity fees for unresolved HTLCs.

recent_posts.title: Multipath Keysend
recent_posts.summary:
- ZmnSCPxj proposed a scheme for multipath payments in the Lightning-dev mailing list.
- The scheme uses TLV 5482373484 to embed the preimage and generate the payment hash.
- Receiver holds payments until all parts arrive, XORs preimages together, and claims funds.

active_posts.title: Standardisation of an unstructured taproot annex
active_posts.summary:
- The taproot annex is currently non-standard, but conversations lean towards a flexible TLV format.
- Making the annex available in a non-structured form allows immediate utilization without delays.
- This approach offers immediate utilization, future flexibility, and chainspace efficiency for developers.

active_posts.title: Blinded 2-party Musig2
active_posts.summary:
- A blinded server in statechains does not learn certain information to maintain privacy.
- Security in blinded statechains relies on the statechain server reporting partial signatures.
- The 2-of-2 musig2 protocol involves key and nonce aggregation for generating signatures.

active_posts.title: Pull-req to enable Full-RBF by default
active_posts.summary:
- The author submitted a pull request to enable full-replace-by-fee in Bitcoin Core by default.
- Many block explorers, nodes, and wallets already support and enable full-replace-by-fee.
- Enabling full-replace-by-fee by default in Bitcoin Core is proposed to address adoption barriers.

active_posts.title: HTLC Endorsement for Jamming Mitigation
active_posts.summary:
- The email updates on channel jamming and provides details for the next call.
- The group plans to gather data on HTLC endorsement and local reputation tracking for jamming mitigation.
- The email proposes a reputation scheme and outlines the steps for mitigating channel jamming.

active_posts.title: Potential vulnerability in Lightning backends: BOLT-11 "payment hash" does not commit to payment!
active_posts.summary:
- LNbits discovered an exploit allowing attackers to create balances through invoice manipulation.
- LNbits version 0.10.5 has patched the exploit, urging users to update immediately.
- Attack highlights the need for caution and proactive measures to address vulnerabilities in Lightning applications.

active_posts.title: Blinded Paths Doom Scenario
active_posts.summary:
- Blinded paths in the Lightning Network offer privacy benefits for receiving nodes.
- Payments can only be made through given paths, potentially favoring "compliant" nodes.
- Concerns arise about compromised privacy and the trade-off between receiver privacy and "chain analysis" prevention.
